intro: Haplopteris hirta, commonly known as the hairy maidenhair fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Hymenophyllaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds that are covered in fine, hairy structures, giving it a distinctive appearance. This plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or rocky crevices, where it can thrive in high humidity. Its reproductive structures, known as sori, are located on the underside of the fronds and produce spores for propagation. Haplopteris hirta is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, showcasing its adaptability to humid climates.
